mdRecord.dcterms:creator: McKim, Mead, and White (American architectural firm, 1879-1910) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: "As a focus for the community at Short Hills, [Stewart] Hartshorn also asked McKim, Mead & White to create a suburban centerpiece, a music hall, next to the train station. It functional as an all-purpose building for decades, and gave Short Hills a visual and civic identity. The music hall was a Norman manoir with a very picturesque tower in the form of a rookery or dovecote. This fanciful building presented a smiling face to the community until it burned down in 1976." -- Broderick, Mosette. Triumvirate: McKim Mead & White. New York: Knopf, 2010. p. 180. [Includes a photo of the Casino with the dates 1879-1880.] [work]
